meanings.definition: To cause (something) to be out of focus.
meanings.sent1: She defocused the camera to create a blurry effect.
meanings.sent2: The photographer defocused the background to make the subject stand out.
meanings.sent3: By defocusing the image, she turned a clear picture into a dreamy scene.
meanings.sent4: His mind defocused on the task at hand, lost in thoughts of the upcoming vacation.
meanings.sent5: The artist defocused the painting, giving it a soft and ethereal quality.

meanings.definition: To divert one's attention or focus away from something.
meanings.sent1: He defocused his mind from the stressful situation by focusing on his breathing.
meanings.sent2: She defocused her attention from the negative comments and focused on the positive feedback instead.
meanings.sent3: During the boring lecture, he defocused his attention by doodling in his notebook.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise outside defocused her concentration from studying for the exam.
meanings.sent5: To relax, she defocused her thoughts by imagining herself on a peaceful beach.
